meanings.def: to fill a hole with a substance or piece of material that fits tightly into it
examples: He plugged the hole in the pipe with an old rag.
Divers succeeded in plugging the leaks from the tanker.

meanings.def: to provide something that has been missing from a particular situation and is needed in order to improve it
examples: A cheaper range of products was introduced to plug the gap at the lower end of the market.

meanings.def: to give praise or attention to a new book, film, etc. in order to encourage people to buy it or see it
examples: She came on the show to plug her latest album.

meanings.def: a small plastic object with two or three metal pins that connects a piece of electrical equipment to the main supply of electricity
examples: The iron is fitted with a three-pin plug.
I'll have to change the plug on my hairdryer.

meanings.def: a small opening in a wall, by which you connect a piece of electrical equipment to the main supply of electricity
examples: Can I use this plug for my iron?

meanings.def: a small object that connects a wire from one piece of electrical equipment to an opening in another
examples: the plug from the computer to the printer
I pushed the jack plug into the amp.

meanings.def: a part in a car engine that produces a spark (= a flash of electricity) which makes the fuel burn and starts the engine
a thick round piece of plastic, rubber or metal that you put in the hole in a bath or a sink to stop the water flowing out
examples: She pulled out the plug and let the water drain away.
There was plenty of hot water, but there was no bath plug.
a jar with a tight-fitting lid
a bath plug

meanings.def: a round piece of material that fits into a hole and blocks it
examples: She took the plug of cotton wool from her ear.
We fixed the leak with a plug made from an old cloth.

meanings.def: an object that fits into the top of a bottle to close it
examples: a jar with a tight-fitting lid
a bath plug

meanings.def: a small plastic tube that you put into a hole in a wall so that it will hold a screw
praise or attention that somebody gives to a new book, film, etc. in order to encourage people to buy or see it
examples: He managed to get in a plug for his new book.

meanings.def: to put an end to somebody’s project, a plan, etc.
examples: The television company pulled the plug on the series after only five episodes.
They decided to pull the plug on the project.

idioms.def: to put an end to somebody’s project, a plan, etc.
examples: The television company pulled the plug on the series after only five episodes.
They decided to pull the plug on the project.
